intro: Chaenorhinum yildirimlii, commonly known as the Turkish Horned Poppy, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers with a distinctive horn-shaped structure at the base. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
